## Discussion

Normally, the presence of custom left bar button items causes the Back button to be removed in favor of the custom items. Setting this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] causes the items in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationItem/leftBarButtonItems] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationItem/leftBarButtonItem] property to be displayed to the right of the Back button — that is, they’re displayed in addition to, not instead of, the Back button. When set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], the items in those properties are displayed instead of the Back button. The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

# leftItemsSupplementBackButton

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the left items display in addition to the Back button.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var leftItemsSupplementBackButton: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

Normally, the presence of custom left bar button items causes the Back button to be removed in favor of the custom items. Setting this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] causes the items in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationItem/leftBarButtonItems] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationItem/leftBarButtonItem] property to be displayed to the right of the Back button — that is, they’re displayed in addition to, not instead of, the Back button. When set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], the items in those properties are displayed instead of the Back button. The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

The value in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationItem/hidesBackButton] property still determines whether the Back button is actually displayed.

## Getting and setting properties

- **prompt**: A single line of text that displays at the top of the navigation bar.

items.description: A single line of text that displays at the top of the navigation bar.
items.name: prompt
